text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

As some of you may know I am a huge Game of
Thrones fan.

I have read 5 of the books and I love the
TV series.

Every time the show comes out I like to host
a big viewing party at my house.

Where I’ll make themed foods and drinks.
And a little bit ago I posted a Game

of Thrones White Walker Drink on my Instagram,
and I got so many requests from you
guys to make the drink.

You guys were saying Ro, make a video to show
us how you made those drinks.

So today we are gonna be making Game of Thrones
White Walker Drinks.
Let’s get started!

We are gonna be making 2 different versions
of this drink. We are gonna be making

the non-alcoholic version, and, the spirited
version.

To make the spirited version, the things you
will need, will be:

Blue Curacao Liqeur, Godiva White Chocolate
Liqeur, club soda, and then both

of the drinks will need ice, glasses, I’m
using Hurricane Glasses, but you can use

any type that you’d like, and these cute
little straws, I got 2 different colors,

blue with white and white with blue so
that you can tell the non-alcoholic

from the spirited versions by which kind of
straw it has.
I thought that was pretty clever.

Then to make the non-alcoholic White Walker
drink you will need blue curaçao

syrup, not the liqeur, because it will have
the same taste, but not the alcohol.

You’re also gonna use a white chocolate
syrup, instead of the Godiva, because this
is also non-alcoholic.

You’ll need a shaker, and you’ll also
need a little bit of club soda.
Now let’s put it all together!
Because Winter’s Coming!

The first drink that we’re gonna be making
is the Spirited White Walker, so the

first thing that we’re gonna do is you’re
gonna fill your entire glass with ice.

I don’t know how to do this correctly, so
this is what I do.
I just scoop it in there.
I’m not a bartender…

I just moonlight as one on Game of Thrones
Viewing party nights!

Now we’re gonna add the white chocolate
liqeur, and we’re gonna fill it up to be
about an inch high at the bottom of our cup.

After you’ve added your white chocolate,
now we are gonna add our club soda.
And you are gonna fill it to the very top.

OK, here we go, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh behave,
behave!
Yes!

And you’re also going to want to slowly
pour this in, so it will keep all of the
white chocolate on the bottom.

OK now, last but not least we’re gonna add our
blue liqeur.

And we’re just gonna add a splash at the
top.

And again, you’re going to slowly pour it
in, try to pour it over the ice so that
the colors don’t blend.
So Spirited version, I'm gonna put a little blue straw in there.

Alright, there is our spirited White Walker,
and you can make as many of these as
you like.

And now we’re gonna move onto our non-alcoholic
White Walker.

I did an interview with Entertainment Weekly
and they asked me, what is the

last thing you googled, and I said, Kit Harrington
Hair Watch!
Who else is in? Who else is doing that?
And they kind of looked at me like, what?
And I said… Check it out!

Now we’re gonna make the non-alcoholic white
walker drinks.

And the first thing that you’re gonna do
is you’re gonna take your shaker,

and we’re gonna add some stuff in here and
shake it up!

The first thing that we’re gonna add is
a little bit of white chocolate sauce.
And you’re just gonna put in a big squirt. I, no, I don’t know an amount. I just, I just go for it!
Here we go!
Big squirt!
Great!

Now, you’re gonna add a little bit of water,
just a splash of water.
Boop!
And some ice…
This will be a minute…

Even though I’m slow, I’m not as slow
as George R.R. Martin.
Write the next book!
I’m just kidding! I love you George!
Now you’re gonna put the shaker top on.
Mamrie Hart taught me how to do this.

Because we made Harry Potter drinks together,
and now, I know how to shake it like
she does, are you ready?
Yeah!
Oooh that’s col…
Ooooh! That’s cold!
Now we’re gonna fill up our glass with ice.

Just like before we are gonna fill our white
mixture about an inch high at
the bottom of our cup.

Now we’re gonna add our club soda, and you’re
gonna fill it all the way to the top.
Oooh!

And you’re gonna want to pour it slowly
and over the ice, so that the colors
will stay separate.

Now last but not least we’re gonna add our
blue syrup, remember this is the

non-alcoholic syrup, not the liqeur, it has
the same citrus flavor, it’s really yummy!

And we’re just gonna drizzle a little over
the top, on the top of the ice.

And for a little decoration and organization,
we’re gonna add the white

straw with the blue polka-dot. So that people
will know that these ones
are the non-alcoholic version
Ta-da!

Here are our Game of Thrones White Walker
inspired Drinks!

I hope you guys enjoyed them, thanks you so much
for suggesting I make a video of
how to make these. I love these drinks!

They are so fun if you’re having a Game
of Thrones viewing party,
yummy-yummy-yummy-yummy!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of these
drinks on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter

and Instagram. If you guys make these, please
take a picture and send me a photo,

I love seeing your baking creations, I get
a big kick out of it, it makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please

let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again, bye-bye!
